website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Core i7-5960X Extreme Edition offers eight cores (and 16 threads), resulting in stunning speeds on multithreaded workloads. If raw CPU power is your top priority and you've got the cash, this is the CPU to get.
pros: Massive performance, with highly threaded workloads
cons: Stock clock speed is lower than previous-generation Extreme Edition chip
Not compatible with previous-gen Socket 2011 motherboards or DDR3 RAM
Less powerful chips with higher clock speeds perform better on tasks that aren't heavily threaded

customer_reviews.title: A dream
customer_reviews.text: I use it for video editing - I can have the entire Adobe Suite open and running, and browse the web for cat videos while it's rendering. I have never had any issues with it in the past 2 years, and I am sure it will still be at least another 3 years before I even consider overclocking it. Never seen it go past 60 degrees even after rendering for hours, with just air cooling.
customer_reviews.author: i. i.

customer_reviews.title: it's fun now to work with 3D and 2D software I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: it's really fast fast...... fast! OC to 4.4 Ghz no problems ,it's fun now to work with 3D and 2D software I'm happy 100% with the result
customer_reviews.author: M.N

customer_reviews.title: An excellent CPU and still as valid and powerful today as ...
customer_reviews.text: An excellent CPU and still as valid and powerful today as when it was initially released. It's a beast and I have mine overclocked to 4.3Ghz constantly (admittedly under liquid rather than air).
customer_reviews.author: SM Davies

customer_reviews.title: Dream for Post Production
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some light gaming and video editing. Gaming - Doesn't really have any extra performance Video Editing - One word.... Woah. Handled everything I throw at it. Using Adobe Premier Pro with Red Giant plugin's Depending how many effects/ frame size, I can pretty much get real time exporting (Cooled with Corsair H110i GT, idle 24°, load 39°)
customer_reviews.author: jake sullivan

customer_reviews.title: at the top everything looks small and weak
customer_reviews.text: God DAMN!! this is fast i went from the 4790k to this and sweet mother it was a great decision
customer_reviews.author: mathew

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor but no heat sink!
customer_reviews.text: Great processor. Be warned however, that since many people over lock these and therefore need extra cooling, this processor ships with no standard cooler. I'd recommend a large air cooling unit. The temperatures run at a maximum of about 65C with a large air cooler (when stress tested). You won't need any more than that if you're not over clocking! I'm not over locking this so can't speak for what point you'll need to look at water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: 4Ghz and purring like a kitten
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's clocking at 4.4Ghz and purring like a kitten. This is an expensive processor but if you're into gaming then I understand the 5930K is as good and about 5/8 the price. On the 5960x the media conversions I've done have taken 1/2 the time as the i7 3840QM (which is blinding quick too). If you want a good processor and can afford it, then this should be a front line contender.
customer_reviews.author: MissP

customer_reviews.title: Its a pretty expensive chip
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty expensive chip, but for me its worth it because I run music software which requires many threads of processing. I've clocked mine at 4.7GHz, and with 8 cores it blows my previous 6 core chip away, especially with the new X99 motherboard and the latest memory and SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Anon797979

customer_reviews.title: Well its the best cpu outthere right now
customer_reviews.text: Well its the best cpu outthere right now. get a good liquid cooling on top of that and u will be amazed like i was :) .. its not a gaming cpu but realy does the job i even got some extra fps on mmo mass pvp gaming situations. not to mention that u can even encode movies play games the system does slow down at all :) Excelent :)
customer_reviews.author: Chrysovalandes Sophocleous

customer_reviews.title: Don't get me wrong, but there are cheaper options ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, but there are cheaper options for roughly the same performance. Really you're just paying for the name.
customer_reviews.author: john Robertson

product_meta.title: Intel i7 5960X Extreme Octa Core CPU Processor (3.0 GHz, 20 MB Cache, 140 W, Socket 2011-V3)
product_meta.description:
Intel Hyper-Threading Technology (Intel HT Technology)1 uses processor resources more efficiently, enabling multiple threads to run on each core. As a performance feature, Intel HT Technology also increases processor throughput, improving overall performance on threaded software.

With Intel HT Technology, multimedia enthusiasts can create, edit, and encode graphically intensive files while running background applications, such as virus protection software, without compromising system performance.

Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.01 automatically allows processor cores to run faster than the rated operating frequency if they're operating below power, current, and temperature specification limits.

Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 is activated when the Operating System (OS) requests a frequency higher than the rated frequency of the processor. Whether the processor enters into and the amount of time the processor spends in the Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 state depends on the workload and operating environment.

Maximum turbo frequency indicates the highest possible frequency achievable when conditions allow the processor to enter turbo mode. Intel Turbo Boost Technology frequency varies depending on workload, hardware, software and overall system configuration.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x CPU
feature_bullets: First Desktop with DDR4 (4 Channels at 2133 MHz)
